alert.note: Alert for Orange County Inland (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Excessive Heat Warning issued September 08 at 8:19PM PDT until September 09 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PDT FRIDAY... ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM FRIDAY TO MIDNIGHT PDT FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Excessive Heat Warning, dangerously hot conditions with temperatures up to 97. For the Wind Advisory, east winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...Orange County Inland Areas. * WHEN...For the Excessive Heat Warning, until 8 PM PDT Friday. For the Wind Advisory, from 6 AM Friday to midnight PDT Friday night. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Extreme heat will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. This is especially true during warm or hot weather when car interiors can reach lethal temperatures in a matter of minutes.
